matador_BusinessLogic

Class Spil

  • java.lang.Object
    • matador_BusinessLogic.Spil

  • public class Spil
extends java.lang.Object
    Plays a game using two dies with the possible values from 1-6. The rules of the game can be modified in the constructor, the basic rules are as follows: Two Spiller will take turns to roll two dies. The value of the two dies will be adding to their running total. The first Spiller to 25 points or more will win. spiller1 will always start the game.

    The rules can be modified with a constructor, the extra options are:

    • toEnere If true you will lose all you points by rolling the values 1 and 1 in the same turn
    • toEns If true you will gain an extra turn by rolling two of the same values in one turn
    • toSeksere If true you will win if you roll two sixes in two consequtive turns
    • vind52 If true winning required 52 points and then rolling two of the same values
    • gui If true turns on the GUI
    Author:
    Martin Caspersen
    See Also:
    Spiller, MatadorRafleBaeger, Terning

    • Constructor Detail

      • Spil

        public Spil()
        Constructor that will start the game. Creates the baeger using MatadorRafleBaeger and two players of type Spiller. Will set all extra conditions to false and play the game using the basic rules.

      • Spil

        public Spil(boolean toEnere,
    boolean toEns,
    boolean toSeksere,
    boolean vind52,
    boolean gui)
        Constructor that starts the game. Will create the baeger using MatadorRafleBaeger with two Terning objects and two players of type Spiller. This constructor allows the extra conditions to be turned on or off.
        Parameters:
        toEnere - If true you will lose all you points by rolling the values 1 and 1 in the same turn
        toEns - If true you will gain an extra turn by rolling two of the same values in one turn
        toSeksere - If true you will win if you roll two sixes in two consequtive turns
        vind52 - If true winning required 52 points and then rolling two of the same values
        gui - If true turns on the GUI

      • Spil

        public Spil(int numPlayers,
    int numTerning,
    boolean toEnere,
    boolean toEns,
    boolean toSeksere,
    boolean vind52,
    boolean gui)
        Constructor that starts the game. Will create the baeger using MatadorRafleBaeger with numTerning amount of Terning objects. Spil will create numPlayers amount of Spiller objects for use in the game.
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - The amount of Spiller objects to be created for the game
        numTerning - The amount of Terning objects to be created in the baeger
        toEnere - If true you will lose all you points by rolling the values 1 and 1 in the same turn
        toEns - If true you will gain an extra turn by rolling two of the same values in one turn
        toSeksere - If true you will win if you roll two sixes in two consecutive turns
        vind52 - If true winning required 52 points and then rolling two of the same values
        gui - If true turns on the GUI
